ValueSetDefinition.Description: This value set defines all values for the patient administrative sex.
ValueSetDefinition.Name: Administrative Sex

ValueElement.Comments: This concept and all its decendents in the specimen hierarchy. A crossmapping table exists between SCT codes and the HL70487 codes - care should be taken to use either one or the other in the negotiated value set, so that each concept is represented ONLY once

Note: This code is used in an application level acknowledgement message when an incoming message has been successfully parsed and processed and there are no hard or soft errors. Parsing and processing may include validating conformance to IG and evaluation of ability of receiving system to consume and store content.
ValueElement.DisplayName: Original mode: Application Accept - Enhanced mode: Application acknowledgment: Accept

ValueElement.Comments: Note: This code is used in an application level acknowledgement message when there are hard and/or soft errors within the incoming message that do not preclude processing at least part of the message. Parsing and processing may include validating conformance to IG and evaluation of ability of receiving system to consume and store content.
ValueElement.DisplayName: Original mode: Application Error - Enhanced mode: Application acknowledgment: Error

ValueElement.Comments: Note: This code is used in an application level acknowledgement message when there are hard errors within the incoming message that suspend processing of the entire message. Parsing and processing may include validating conformance to IG and evaluation of ability of receiving system to consume and store content.
ValueElement.DisplayName: Original mode: Application Reject - Enhanced mode: Application acknowledgment: Reject

ValueElement.Comments: Note: This code is used in the system level acknowledgement message when an incoming message has been successfully received. This is not used to acknowledge successful parsing or processing of the message.
ValueElement.DisplayName: Enhanced mode: Accept acknowledgment: Commit Accept
Enhanced mode: Accept acknowledgment: Commit Error

ValueElement.Comments: Note: This code is used in the system level acknowledgement message when receipt of an incoming message has failed. This is not used to acknowledge message parsing or processing errors.
ValueElement.DisplayName: Enhanced mode: Accept acknowledgment: Commit Reject

core problem list subset for OBR-31

ValueElement.Comments: LOI: If no user components of HL70072 or locally defined table, use the default value of NA (not applicable) from Table HL70353 CWE Status Codes or draw another appropriate value from Table HL70353.

ValueElement.DisplayName: Profile or battery consisting of many independent atomic observations (e.g., SMA12, electrolytes), usually done at one instrument on one specimen
Functional procedure that may consist of one or more interrelated measures (e.g., glucose tolerance test, creatinine clearance), usually done at different times and/or on different specimens
Atomic service/test/observation (test code or treatment code)

Superset--a set of batteries or procedures ordered under a single code unit but processed as separate batteries (e.g., routines = CBC, UA, electrolytes). This set indicates that the code being described is used to order multiple service/test/observation batteries. This set indicates that the code being described is used to order multiple service/test/observation batteries. For example, a client who routinely orders a CBC, a differential, and a thyroxine as an outpatient profile might use a single, special code to order all three test batteries, instead of having to submit three separate order codes.

Single observation calculated via a rule or formula from other independent observations (e.g., Alveolar--arterial ratio, cardiac output) This set indicates that the code being described is used to order multiple service/test/observation batteries. For example, a client who routinely orders a CBC, a differential, and a thyroxine as an outpatient profile might use a single, special code to order all three Single observation calculated via a rule or formula from other independent observations (e.g., Alveolar--arterial ratio, cardiac output)
Drug Furnishing or prescriptive authority Number

ValueElement.Comments: SR - R (Required) for the reciever; The sender must support (S) a least one in the set mark as SR. SR means one in the set marked as SR is required to be supported by the sender and required by the receiver.

ValueElement.DisplayName: National Person Identifier where the xxx is the ISO table 3166 3-character (alphabetic) country code
Medicare/CMS (formerly HCFA)_s Universal Physician Identification numbers

ValueElement.Comments: SR - R (Required) for the reciever; The sender must support (S) a least one in the set mark as SR. SR means one in the set marked as SR is required to be supported by the sender and required by the receiver.

ValueElement.DisplayName: Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes

ValueElement.Comments: Note: for CDM-7, the requirement is that the code SHALL be drawn from CPT-4, the string "CPT-4" is not conveyed in the CDM-7

ValueElement.DisplayName: Error/Reject conditions only. Only MFA segments denoting errors must be returned via the application-level acknowledgment for this message
Always. All MFA segments (whether denoting errors or not) must be returned via the application-level acknowledgment message
Success. Only MFA segments denoting success must be returned via the application-level acknowledgment for this message

(HL7 base comment) This specimen is Preferred for all attributes (Container and Additive) identified in the OM4 segment.
(HL7 base comment) This is a specimen that is acceptable as a replacement for a preferred specimen. In the following field (OM4-17), the sequence number of the preferred specimen must be messaged.
